wikipedia_page.main:
Alan Victor Stewart (24 July 1922 – 24 July 2004) was an English professional footballer.
Stewart began his career with Huddersfield Town in 1946. He joined York City in 1949, where he was a part of the team which played in the FA Cup semi-final in 1955. He retired in 1957.

response: Burgin also played professional football; he signed for Sheffield United in December 1946 and played for their reserve team in the Central League. He joined Third Division North club York City in May 1949 and competed with Alan Stewart for the centre half spot in the team. He made 23 appearances before injury forced him to retire in August 1951.

*W. F. Alan Stewart (1885–1956), Canadian farmer, fox rancher and political figure
